results.title: The Serve with Billie Jean King
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “On Tennis”.
Billie Jean King, Vic Braden and Erik Van Dellen start with the simple ‘flat’ serve, then move on to demonstrate the ‘slice’ and the ‘twist’, with detailed coverage of such basics as stance and grip, step and weight transfer, co-ordinating the toss with the swing, and proper follow-through.

results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Omnibus”
Portrait of an English drama teacher, Dorothy Heathcote. Shows her work in Tyneside with a variety of young people from an approved school, a junior school, and a hospital for the mentally handicapped.
Suitable for teacher/tertiary level.

results.title: Chiang Mai: northern capital
results.creator_credit: Brian Hannant, John Morris, Thanom Soongnarata and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian Neighbours: Thailand”.
In Chiang Mai, Thailand’s northern capital, many traditions and crafts have remained unchanged for hundreds of years. This film looks at the native handicrafts, including the production of silver jewellery, lacquerware utensils and silk-weaving. We take part in a colourful festival which marks the end of the Buddhist Lent. Through the day and into the night we see the solemn religious ceremonies, and the carefree carnival, complete with fireworks

results.title: Parting shots from animals
results.creator_credit: Christopher Rawlence, Michael Dibb and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Omnibus”.
Based on essays by John Berger, the film looks at how man’s exploitation of animals has affected himself. From a variety of locations ranging from circuses to slaughterhouses, the evolution of man’s attitude to animals is traced.
